    • Method Detail

      • of

        @Nonnull
public static <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> SyncRPC<R> of​(@Nonnull
                                                                    R request)
        Wrap the provided request in a synchronous RPC operation, which intends to block until a result is ready from the remote service; any resulting message is returned directly to invoking code, and any thrown exception is raised directly within invoking code.

        As the simplest method variant, acquiring an RPC operation wrapper through this method will set a default timeout and use default call context on behalf of the developer. See other method options to control these aspects of execution.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Message type for the request payload.
        Parameters:
        request - Request which we intend to send to the server synchronously.
        Returns:
        Synchronous RPC operation.
        See Also:
        Specify a custom RPC timeout, Create a sync RPC with context

      • sync

        @Nonnull
public static <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> SyncRPC<R> sync​(@Nonnull
                                                                      R request,
                                                                      @Nonnull
                                                                      Timeout timeout)
        Wrap the provided request in a synchronous RPC operation, which intends to block until a result is ready from the remote service; any resulting message is returned directly to invoking code, and any thrown exception is raised directly within invoking code.

        This method variant allows specification of a custom timeout value, which is enforced no matter what happens after the remote request begins execution. To additionally control call-specific call context, see the "See Other" section for this method.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Request message type.
        Parameters:
        request - Request operation to wrap in a synchronous RPC container.
        timeout - Timeout value to apply to this operation.
        Returns:
        Synchronous RPC container.
        See Also:
        Create a sync RPC with context

      • sync

        @Nonnull
public static <R extends com.google.protobuf.Message> SyncRPC<R> sync​(@Nonnull
                                                                      R request,
                                                                      @Nonnull
                                                                      Timeout timeout,
                                                                      @Nullable
                                                                      com.google.api.gax.rpc.ApiCallContext context)
        Wrap the provided request in a synchronous RPC operation, which intends to block until a result is ready from the remote service; any resulting message is returned directly to invoking code, and any thrown exception is raised directly within invoking code.

        This method variant allows full customization of the synchronous operation, including the timeout applied, and any call-specific context.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Request message type.
        Parameters:
        request - Request operation to wrap in a synchronous RPC container.
        timeout - Timeout value to apply to this operation.
        Returns:
        Synchronous RPC container.

      • unwrap

        @Nonnull
public AsyncRPC<R> unwrap()
        Convert a synchronous RPC operation into an asynchronous RPC operation, preserving the request, timeout, and any call context assigned.

        Synchronous methods are implemented via async with a simple wrapper that blocks until a result is ready. Thus, every synchronous RPC travels through this method before execution. The distinction between synchronous and asynchronous operations also allows clean method signatures without triggering type erasure problems.

        Returns:
        Asynchronous RPC operation corresponding to this synchronous operation.

public final R request()
